docs.snippet: All telephone numbers in Spain, except those assigned to mobile phones, increased to nine digits last month, affecting both international and local calls....
docs.abstract: All telephone numbers in Spain increase to nine digits (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: All telephone numbers in Spain, except those assigned to mobile phones, increased to nine digits last month, affecting both international and local calls.

headline.main: Spain's Phone Numbers Get a Little Longer

docs.snippet: Libertad, the largest sailing vessel in the Western Hemisphere, and at least 10 other tall ships will take part in the Americas' Sail Tall Ships Festival in Savannah, Ga., from July 3 to 5 before the start of the Americas' Sail '98 race from Savan...
docs.abstract: Libertad, largest sailing vessel in Western Hemisphere, and at least 10 other tall ships will take part in Americas' Sail Tall Ships Festival in Savannah, Ga, from July 3 to 5, before start of Americas' Sail '98 race from Savannah to Montauk, on Long Island; photo of The Eagle, part of Americas' Sail (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Libertad, the largest sailing vessel in the Western Hemisphere, and at least 10 other tall ships will take part in the Americas' Sail Tall Ships Festival in Savannah, Ga., from July 3 to 5 before the start of the Americas' Sail '98 race from Savannah to Montauk, on Long Island. The vessels scheduled to take part include Libertad, representing Argentina; Barba Negra, Eagle, Rose, Meka II and Norseman, representing the United States, and Simon Bolivar, for Venezuela. Simon Bolivar will defend the Americas' Sail Trophy, which it has held since the first Americas' Sail race in 1995. In Savannah, the ships will join in a Parade of Sail on July 3, and the public will be able to board them on July 4 and 5. The festival will also offer marching bands, food and crafts along Riverstreet and fireworks.

headline.main: Tall Ships Festival In Savannah on July 4

docs.snippet: The Maui Ocean Center, an aquarium and five-acre marine park, opened on March 13, recreating underwater environments of the Hawaiian islands. Visitors can learn how Hawaii's volcanic formations, deep-water channels and isolation from other land ma...
docs.abstract: New Maui Ocean Center, aquarium and marine park, recreates underwater environments of Hawaiian islands; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The Maui Ocean Center, an aquarium and five-acre marine park, opened on March 13, recreating underwater environments of the Hawaiian islands. Visitors can learn how Hawaii's volcanic formations, deep-water channels and isolation from other land masses have combined to create a distinctive reef environment. The center has more than 60 exhibit tanks or pools filled with coral, lava tubes and a variety of fish and marine life. Species on display include brightly colored tropical fish, green sea turtles, eagle rays and jellyfish.

headline.main: Maui Marine Park Opens Hawaiian Waters

docs.snippet: The new equipment that looks for bombs in the checked baggage of airline passengers also lays stripes on photographic film packed inside, according to the Federal Aviation Administration and the manufacturer. When the picture is developed into a 4...
docs.abstract: Federal Aviation Administration says new equipment that looks for bombs in checked baggage of airline passengers also lays stripes on photographic film packed inside; Photographic and Imaging Association recommends that travelers carry film with them or buy film when reaching destination and have it developed before getting back on the plane (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The new equipment that looks for bombs in the checked baggage of airline passengers also lays stripes on photographic film packed inside, according to the Federal Aviation Administration and the manufacturer. When the picture is developed into a 4-by-6 print, the stripe is about as thick as three lines of type in this newspaper, and consists of graininess or color change. Many passengers pack their film in checked bags to avoid putting it through the X-ray machines that scan carry-ons. But according to the trade group that represents film makers, the Photographic and Imaging Manufacturers Association, those machines put out far less energy than the new bag scanners. On film slower than 1,000 ASA, the machines hardly ever cause problems, even on repeated passes.

headline.main: Scanner Spoils Film In Checked Bags

docs.snippet: HAWAII RENEWED -- The Kapalua Bay Hotel on Maui, which recently reopened after a six-month renovation, is offering an introductory rate of $199 for an ocean-view room through July 31 (tax of 10.166 percent is extra). The resort, on 18 beachfront a...
docs.abstract: List of some current travel discount offerings
docs.lead_paragraph: HAWAII RENEWED -- The Kapalua Bay Hotel on Maui, which recently reopened after a six-month renovation, is offering an introductory rate of $199 for an ocean-view room through July 31 (tax of 10.166 percent is extra). The resort, on 18 beachfront acres, has 191 rooms and 3 suites, all with new bathrooms; three golf courses; two tennis complexes; two swimming pools, and a new fitness center. For information or reservations, call (800) 367-8000 or (808) 669-5656; or look on the Internet at www.kapaluabay.com. SWISS PACKAGES -- Swiss air has packages to Geneva or Zurich starting at $1,158 in April, May and October for packages to Geneva or Zurich. The price (which starts at $1,366 from June through September) includes round-trip air fare from New York, Newark or Boston; six nights' hotel stay; daily breakfast and a week's car rental with unlimited mileage. A package that includes only air fare and a week's rental of an economy car (like a Fiat Panda) starts at $825 in April, May and October and ranges up to $994 in high season for midweek departures. The prices, guaranteed in dollars, are per person and based on two people traveling together. Reservations: (800) 688-7947.

docs.snippet: More than 250 works by Alexander Calder will go on view at the National Gallery of Art in Washington on March 29 in a retrospective marking the 100th anniversary of his birth.    The exhibition, including many works on paper, paintings and jewelry...
docs.abstract: *National Gallery of Art in Washington, DC, to open Alexander Calder retrospective on March 29 (S)g
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 250 works by Alexander Calder will go on view at the National Gallery of Art in Washington on March 29 in a retrospective marking the 100th anniversary of his birth. The exhibition, including many works on paper, paintings and jewelry as well as his famed kinetic and stable sculptures, will fill galleries and public spaces on several levels of the East Building and part of the lawn. Many of the early works have never been shown or have not been seen publicly since a Calder retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art in 1943; others have been exhibited only rarely.

docs.snippet: Baseball fans do not have to wait for opening day to catch their favorite team. In February, major league baseball teams head to spring training camps in Florida and Arizona. Sports Tours, a Massachusetts-based company specializing in travel to sp...
docs.abstract: Sports Tours, a Massachusetts-based company specializing in travel to sporting events, has packages to help baseball fans attend preseason games in February (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Baseball fans do not have to wait for opening day to catch their favorite team. In February, major league baseball teams head to spring training camps in Florida and Arizona. Sports Tours, a Massachusetts-based company specializing in travel to sporting events, has packages to help baseball fans attend preseason games.

docs.snippet: A new automotive museum has just opened next to the Motor City.     The Automotive Hall of Fame, a single-level building with lots of tinted glass and a pyramid-shaped central skylight, was financed by the automobile industry and opened in August ...
docs.abstract: Automotive Hall of Fame opened in August in Dearborn, Mich; museum focuses on people behind the machines: inventors, business people and factory workers of global auto industry (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: A new automotive museum has just opened next to the Motor City. The Automotive Hall of Fame, a single-level building with lots of tinted glass and a pyramid-shaped central skylight, was financed by the automobile industry and opened in August in Dearborn. It is not, contrary to expectations, a collection of rare cars behind velvet ropes.

headline.main: Hall of Fame Honors Cars and Their Creators

docs.snippet: Next year marks Israel's 50th anniversary, but the yearlong celebration will begin early -- on Oct. 6 with a concert by the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra at Frederic Mann Auditorium in Tel Aviv. It will be followed the next night by a performance ...
docs.abstract: Celebrations in Israel to mark nation's 50th anniversary will begin in Oct and continue beyond Apr 29, 1998 Independence Day fete (S)û
docs.lead_paragraph: Next year marks Israel's 50th anniversary, but the yearlong celebration will begin early -- on Oct. 6 with a concert by the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra at Frederic Mann Auditorium in Tel Aviv. It will be followed the next night by a performance of ''The Marriage of Figaro'' that will open the 50th-jubilee season of the New Israeli Opera in Tel Aviv. On Dec. 23, the opening ceremony for the 50th jubilee in Jerusalem will coincide with the first night of Hanukkah. The actual 50th anniversary will be observed on April 30.

headline.main: Israel Is Turning 50: Let Celebrations Begin

docs.snippet: SINCE it was created by Congress in 1970, Amtrak has come close to being permanently derailed any number of times. Last month a dispute between Congress and the Clinton Administration over Amtrak employees' severance pay led Congress to withhold t...
docs.abstract: Amtrak makes host of innovations to lure passengers; railroad's future is most heavily dependent on success of its high-speed service in Northeast Corridor between Boston and Washington, DC (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: SINCE it was created by Congress in 1970, Amtrak has come close to being permanently derailed any number of times. Last month a dispute between Congress and the Clinton Administration over Amtrak employees' severance pay led Congress to withhold the $2.3 billion in capital funds that it had voted for the railroad, and soon after that crisis passed the subsidy narrowly escaped a Presidential line-item veto. Now if Congress completes action this month on a bill to streamline Amtrak, and if the railroad and about 2,500 of its maintenance workers use the 60-day cooling-off period imposed by President Clinton on Aug. 21 to settle a threatened strike, Amtrak should have a pretty good indication by this time next year whether it can actually become self-sufficient by 2002, as Congress has decreed it must.

headline.main: In a Fight for Its Life, Amtrak Courts Riders
